texto: 7.8.1 General description Sampling is a statistical methodology for estimating information about some characteristic of a population by studying a representative fraction (i.e. sample) of the population. There are various sampling techniques that can be employed, such as simple random sampling, stratified sampling, systematic sampling, sequential sampling and skip-lot sampling. The choice of technique is determined by the purpose of the sampling and the conditions under which it should be conducted.
